page.title: 18Attitudes E.K. Shopping
page.content: A local shopping survey was done at the Greenhills Shopping Precinct on 19th June 1985.We interviewed twelve people.Nine of the people we interviewed lived in Greenhills,two lived in Whitehills and one lived in Gardenhall.Five people said they did their daily shopping at the Greenhills Shops.We asked them if the shops were adequate and ten people answered NO.We also asked them what other shops they would like to see,if any.Three of the twelve said that they would like a bank,one person said a fruit shop,four people a supermarket and one person a cafe.We asked them if they only used these shops because it was convenient. Eleven people said yes and one person used them because she liked them.All of the people said that these shops are more expensive than at the Town Centre.
